title: Thank you guys...
content:
Thank you to all the PCKFers here on the forum for many wonderful hours spent chatting.

I might have said and done a lot of stupid things in the past, under either of my aliases, but I am grateful that you have been there for some good times, and been there for some bad ones. But, there are two individuals whom I have come to thank.

To eK, thanks for the moral support and advice I needed to start listening to stuff other than the mainstream - especially Bjrk, whose music, once I learned of it, became a light of beauty that broadened my love for music far more than I could imagine.

To Commander Spleen, thanks for showing a good approach to life, you are wise for your age. Your expertise will serve you well.

There have been those whose good humour has been great, and others who can only improve (I will not mention names).

Soon, I am going to turn eighteen years of age ('bout May 12), which means my childhood will soon be over. I will move on to bigger and better things shortly, but I may pop in from time to time. Even if it seems a bit far away, I will have a lot of commitments shortly.

'Til next time, take care of yourselves, and each other, as Jerry Springer says.Australia, n. A country lying in the South Sea, whose industrial and commercial development has been unspeakably retarded by an unfortunate dispute among geographers as to whether it is a continent or an island.
Thomas Nashe
- The Devil's Dictionary

[url=http://kevan.org/brain.cgi?Kangarus%20Gyrfalcon]Weird information on all sorts of weird and wonderful people![/url]

title: Re: Thank you guys...
content:
What you are planning when something is becoming to childish for you before it even is? I visit one of the top ten busiest forums of the world and the average age there lies around the thiry with even people over sixtie years old. So don't be silly.-----------------

title: Re: Thank you guys...
content:
I don't think he's suggesting this board is childish, just that he'll have better things to do. I personally don't see a problem with that. Pity that we have to lose yet another dedicated Keener, but life moves on. More people will come to replace those who leave.

NOOOOO!! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-furious.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img]

title: Re: Thank you guys...
content: Why does anyone think that the childhood ends by the age of 18? Because that's the legal age to drink alcoholic drinks in some countries or what? The childhood never ends [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-crazy.gif[/img]  I won't say anything about leaving the board as that may be a wise idea if all your free time was eaten by the Big Time Eater Monster of the CKPF Board. Good luck with real life [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

title: Re: Better things?
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]You youngsters don't probably get it, but it is so different to be 18 than 13[hr][/quote]
The only difference between being 13 and 18 or even 24 is that others take you more seriously (not always) and your ego grows a lot too [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img] . Mine had [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] but this doesn't mean people become more responsible or anything.

title: Re: Better things?
content: I didn't mean that; only that one's mind is different, at least in my case. Hard to explain, well, thesedays I think 100x more about religious questions and philosophy.Life.. It's worth 20000 points!

title: Any time.
content:
I can only hope you change your mind, but if you feel this is necessary for you to move on in life, then so be it. It's been great sharing this board with you.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img]

Childhood shouldn't end at any age. Whatever you do, don't forget Keen.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-oldy.gif[/img]

And keep an eye on that Pepsi stockpile.

All the best.Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

"Take evasive action!"

title: Re: Better things?
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Hard to explain, well, thesedays I think 100x more about religious questions and philosophy.[hr][/quote]

In a way you're lucky.
I used to think about "The Important Things in Life" a lot when I was young, figuring out "I think, therefore I am", coming to the conclusion I don't believe in gods, that there is no reason for existance, stuff like that.
Now I am bored in the way that it's useless thinking about it more; I just keep reaching the same conclusion everytime.
I'm still hoping for something to happen that will make me reconsider, but I don't expect anything anytime soon.Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten.

content:
